text: Ronald Timothy Renton, Baron Renton of Mount Harry, (28 May 1932 - 25 August 2020) was a British Conservative Party politician. He was a Member of Parliament between 1974 to 1997. He was Minister of State for Immigration between 1987 to 1989 in the Thatcher cabinet and as Minister for the Arts between 1990 to 1992 in the Major cabinet. He was a member of the House of Lords between 1997 to 2016. Renton died on 25 August 2020, aged 88. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Conservative Party (UK) MPs Category:UK MPs 1974 Category:UK MPs 1974–1979 Category:UK MPs 1979–1983 Category:UK MPs 1983–1987 Category:UK MPs 1987–1992 Category:UK MPs 1992–1997 Category:Conservative Life Peers
title: Tim Renton
